positive.review: I'm an Ex MX rider IRL, always loved reflex, and we all know nothing came close. Until i found MX-Bikes. This game is a sim though, so be prepared for a steep learning curve, but once you are through that learning curve, it is the most satisfying MX game i have ever played.
this is the best game on steam imo, please buy this game it will change your life for the better

got little over 20hrs on the game and its mostly motocross supercross seems impossible to learn no matter how hard i try shii should not be that hard just to even learn. if ur new to the game i dont recommend supercross less you feel like raging every second ur playing
super duper pooper mooper cooper looper gooper rooper cool and fun, except not on a keyboard,  play on a controller. Trust me it is a lot easier and more fun.
game is good if u are new to it turn off lean help and check out tuts for certain mods from @ReidCannonn on tiktok

-gets game after watching pros play thinking its cool and fun
-loops bike every time i try riding
-after 5 hours, finally develops skill to go 10 meters without looping
-spends another 10 hours trying to complete one lap
-after 15 hours, finally does one lap without crashing
-spend hours downloading bikes, tracks, etc etc
-grinds game all week
-still shit at every track
-hundreds of dollars gone on mods
10/10 would reccomend
Really fun game. I have four hours on this game, and its really addicting. Really good physics, and a fun challenge to learn how to play. Would reccomend playing.

The Tarkov of dirt bike games - The learning curve is real, but once you get it, there is no looking back.

You do need to mod the game by adding in the current OEM bikes and to get custom tracks - but its an easy process and the community is always pumping out content.

TLDR: I ended up buying a dirt bike because of this game - 5 track days done so far!
sick game with the best physics of all the mx games.
very fun once you spend the weeks of misery to get controllers set up and mods downloaded

really fun game but it takes a long time to just be decent and understand the game and also it is complicated on how to put folders and liveries into the folders and other stuff but it is very realistic
one of the most challiging games ive ever played but also one of the most rewarding.
BEST BIKE GAME EVERY Yeah it on the exspensive side but definley worth it
Very hard game. i recommend because of its different play style. but their are just to many things to know. just to drive around and crash 2 minutes later
best motocrtoss game, expensive but good!!!
absolute perfection, The game is so great from the way the bikes handle to the realism of the tracks and overall realism of the game. 100% worth the money highly recomend
it is a bit hard at first but you get the hang of it allways start small and then progress
I like this game because it is different than all of the other dirt bike games. This is specifically a simulation, it takes a lot to get used to but once you do, the game is a blast!

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚ú® (9/10)

MX Bikes Review ‚Äì Base Game vs Mods

MX Bikes is one of those games that feels massively overpriced at first. The base game alone just isn‚Äôt worth $50 AUD. It‚Äôs barebones, limited, and looks outdated. Playing it without mods honestly feels like you paid full price for half a game.

But once you dive into mods, everything changes. Custom bikes, high-quality tracks, better sounds, graphics packs, gear, physics tweaks ‚Äî the community basically rebuilds the game into something incredible. With mods installed, MX Bikes becomes one of the most realistic and enjoyable motocross sims out there.

Base game? Not worth it.
Base game + mods? Absolutely incredible.
This game is super fun to play but only with mods if you dont have any mods i would to get some from mxb mods it is super easy to get them if you dont get mods the game is still pretty fun to play
Mx Bikes is a fun game. There is races that you can so with your friends. It is a simulater
very fun game to play with friends gets boring after a couple hours would reccomend
Once you get a hang of the physics and controls, the game is really fun.
Really tuff learning curve just got over it. it seems to be great gameplay and has a great community and mod content def worth

This Game is Hard at First but after 5h of playtime u will be alot Better.
Make sure to use Mods they make the game 10x better and alot more Fun!
It took me a while to figure out the mods but this game is super realistic bike wise def reconmend
very fun you will 100% love it but is hard when you first start but when you start to play it a lot you will have a blast
game is super fun once you get the hang of it can be hard at first but don't give up!

I built a pc just for this game and it was so worth it. It has a steep learning curve, but a couple youtube videos and some modding makes the game way more enjoyable. Just take the time to learn the game, trust me.
this game is very fun and is like a carrer game at first its hard but ive played for 20 hours and got very good  i recommed this game to any motocross people
Best motocross game, but with small bugs.

Very artistic and fast sped people. Ramming on start and while racing. Piboso physics are buns. Reccomend if u want
to get brain eating bacteria from other people.
i think if you know the sport it will be easy and also this game gets you addicted to mx bikes it is so good i would play it all the time if i could
it is a good game but it dose crash but it is a good game and you should give the game a try.IT IS A FUN GAME
I hated this game the first time I played it, and the 2nd time, and the 3rd time. I still hate it but I recommend it because now all my other mx games seem pathetic. Okay so I do love this game.
its fun but hard and nothing like any dirtbiking game ive ever played
Great game. the first 50 hours suck, stick past that and youll have fun
its really hard but you slowly understand the game and how to play it and then its not to bad. watch youtube vidoes to get mods its fairly simple and how to play
Hard game to play at first but i love it i only have 44hrs and i would 100 percent recommend
best moto cross game. makes me mad sometimes but its a really good game if you like dirtbikes.
amazing game not easy to play but fun once you get the hang of it but i had issues downloading new bikes which i still havnt figured out
with mods this game is super fun with all the maps and bikes, worth every dollar

it is amazing I love the game it is a great experience truly the only thing I don't like about it is that is glitches the exiting menu pops up all the time hopefully you guys can fix it so that when people like me and my friends can't play together because of that glitch. It is very annoying and i hope you guys can fix it.
very fun game once you get use to the controls and had great graphics.
very good bike game with many mods to add to the game and make the game funner!!!!! would reccomend
Brutal time while you're learning, but mods and proper controls make this game great
this game is hard to learn but once you get the hang of it it is really fun honestly this game is satisfying :)

the most realistic Motocross game on Steam. Just on practice tracks you can spend hours dialing in a tune or just trying to beat your Pb. it takes a long time to get decent but its so rewarding once you start feeling the flow of the game.
It is very hard at the start but if you carry on playing its really fun
Best motocross,supermoto and enduro game. Recomended!!
really relitic and adicting
all the negative reviews are genuinely just skill issues. it only takes about 5 hours to learn the game and 10 hours to be a lil squid. i think about 200 hours and ill be quick.
its a cool game but pls put more bikes in game it would be fun for players to not get mods

this game is super fun if you like dirt bike or like riding irl this will be the game for you the are 100+ bike you can ride in 100+ maps you download in play in also if you wanna go pro you can try in mx bike ranked overall this game is super fun to play on your freetime it a kick back in chill game
Ive had this game for about 39 hours and i have 23.4 hours on it its very hard i would recommend getting mods because the base bikes are really terrible
i love this game but i got a new computer and its better than my old one but now when i logged into my stem it wont launch the game
amazing game really realistic if you want it to be but it is very hard at first probbaably took me 60 hours just to be ok at the game
best dirt bike game ever as long as u have a controller its really easy and super fun !!!!!!

The physics on this game are INSANE compared to any other game, and the modding community is amazing, theres sooooo many mods you can choose from. i really recommend this game. At first it was hard to master but once you get pretty good at it, its a REALLY fun game, throwing whips and scubs that actually effect how the bike goes through the air.
Is the most realistic game with dirtbikes, but is not fun without mods.

Fun but unplayable without mods, mxb mods is probably the best place to go for pretty much anything you need for the game. physics at slow speeds are unpredictable and the learning curve is very steep
is a very fun game and it takes some time to get good with turning, also you will need to change up the setting to make it better for yourself

Really fun to learn. I think the only thing this game is missing is either more bikes (at least 15) and a few more tracks or a in-game mods page that makes downloading and installing mods easier. I can't download the mods I want because it fills up my onedrive and they won't work if I dump them in the game directory. Anyone know how to get the C drive mods to work?
best dirt bike game really realistic a little hard at the start but heeps of fun
the game good but some times glitches for me dont know why but still beatiful master peace
physics are next level! good fun once you get the hang of it. 32 hours at the time of this review and im only now just getting in some OK lap times :)

MX Bikes is by far the best MX simulator with the rig ruts and fast berms, huge whips. It is incredibly unforgiving. At 17 hours I can't make a single lap without a lot of crashes... nearly every corner. You might break a controller and I am not joking. But it is rewarding IF you get it.
This is by far the best motorcross game out there and physics beat everything
this game is my favorite game by far now and the physics are unreal! if you have a pc than i higly recomend buying this game!
it is super fun once you learn it and is really fun to verse your friends in it and overall is a really good game
Very fun, Downside is not super realistic but its ok, you can get actual bike mods like crf, yz, suzuki, kawasaki, etc. and you can get tracks aswell
i will say its a little hard at the start but i just got the 5th gear valley mod and its so fucking fun
Quite challenging at first with stock bikes and grip and stuff but once you have got settings and controler setup its a really fun game to play.
Nice physics, Nice game. kinda hard to learn i guess when you get into mods
this had me screaming at my screen raging and also in joy when you hooked up a rut flat out so much fun when you get the hang of it you just has to see it out at the start while you learn
Assetto corsa for bikes , be ready to download mods
soooo fun but your going to need mods to actually enloy it go to mxb mods to get them.
very good game does not lag and its realy fun
Its very good but need mods or else it bad once you get the mods do not delete because once you do i dont think you can get them back

hands down the beste bike game on pc even betar with modes

fyi if you can not figer out how to downlode modes go to the oem bike pack on mxb modes and  scrole down till you se a coment with a videolikenke folllow the enstructions
hard to get the basics down but very fun playing modded maps. you can download the mods at mxb mods

The tracks are shit as fuck but the phisychs are very good if you like them realistic for me its kinda hard to turn if i fall but the only bad thing is that you have to buy tracks from mymxb shop to play comp and for it to be good
becase it is a gggggggreat game i reccemend buying it NO REGRETS
very tough game, but fun when you start to put it all together
If you man up and put in the time it takes to get good at this game it becomes so much more fun than you might think.
it takes a bit to figure out but once you do its pretty fun do recommend

Out of all motocross games I‚Äôve played, [i]MX Bikes[/i] stands above them all.

With tracks like [b]OIR: Redux[/b] and [b]TV Land MX by Jonesy[/b], especially when using [b]MaxHUD rumble[/b], the feeling of riding and mastering each lap, each rut, becomes something truly special. These tracks aren‚Äôt just fun ‚Äî they‚Äôre alive. Every time you ride them, you feel the terrain teaching you something new.

I try to ride slowly and increase my lap times gradually but consistently. That, to me, is the best approach to mastering this game. If you go too fast too soon, you don‚Äôt give yourself the chance to understand [i]why[/i] you‚Äôre crashing or losing control. When you take it slow and steady, the track starts to make sense ‚Äî you begin to understand how the bike behaves, what causes mistakes, and how to correct them.

That‚Äôs when real learning happens. Before that, it‚Äôs all wasted potential. But once you ride with intention, that potential turns into actual growth.

I‚Äôve played other motocross games like [i]Monster Energy Supercross[/i] or [i]MXGP 2021[/i], thinking they might offer something better in certain areas ‚Äî but after getting used to the realistic ‚ÄúMX Bikes feeling‚Äù, it‚Äôs hard to go back. Those games feel more like [i]arcade experiences[/i], while MX Bikes feels like [i]riding[/i].

I also approach the game as if it were real life ‚Äî imagining that a crash would hurt me badly. That mindset makes me ride smarter and more carefully, not just faster. It turns the experience into something deeper than just a game.

That‚Äôs why I understand the negative reviews: many people expect [i]MX Bikes[/i] to be another [i]MXGP[/i] or [i]MX vs ATV[/i], but it‚Äôs not. It‚Äôs not built for arcade fun ‚Äî it‚Äôs a [i]simulation[/i] meant for those who value realism, patience, and the process of improving.

One last thing: I don‚Äôt like playing against my own trainer or ghost rider version. It adds pressure and distracts me from the track. When you‚Äôre trying to outrun your past self, you stop paying attention to the flow and rhythm that matter most. Improvement comes from understanding the track ‚Äî not from rushing to beat a number.

In the end, [i]MX Bikes[/i] isn‚Äôt just about racing. It‚Äôs about [i]learning[/i]. It rewards focus, discipline, and respect for the craft ‚Äî just like real motocross.
one of the best games i have played never gets boring as you get better and def get mods
fun and great controls
this game very fun but very hard i am slowly becoming addicted
whipping is super fun and feels great
good game has a learning curve but so worth it 10/10
played for 3 hours in 1 day awsome game , the mods are the best bit
great game but theres to many bugs i would recommend buying it when its on sale
The best racing sim of all time. Nobody can replicate MXBikes.
i personally think that this is best bike game,like it is just so much fun.
fun, but challenging
Really fun and with the oem bikes even better
realistic and very fun to play when you are bored!

This game has not good i been playing and if you don't pay for suppention you cant win wich is bull crap

Game is fun, community mod support is fantastic. 

But the Dev has all but abandoned it. There has been a memory leak for windows 11 users for almost a year now.... Cheating runs rampant online and if you bring it up to community members, you get shunned and the kids try to bully you and just tell you "get gud, no one is cheating". There is no anti-cheat in this game so this issue will never be fixed. 

The racing is pretty fun, but the netcode is terrible and you will 100% be t-boned by someone who wasn't near you on their screen. ( netcode hasn't been updated in years and likely never will be.)

This game has been out for soooo long, yet it still crashes when you hit (or look at) a fence the wrong way, players who join your lobby have missing textures on their bikes until you go back to pit and come out of it, it crashes seemingly at random from time to time, etc.

Physics are the best of this game genre but also the worst when they decide to.
50% of players are toxic and/or are using the N word waaay too often.
There's lots of small (and big) annoying details that could be easily fixed by the dev (PiBoso) but will never be (Seeminlgly) (Cause Italians like having an attitude) (Just a joke, don't cancel me)

Anyways, for 40$ CAD i wouldn't recommend buying if you have difficulties to accept defeat (Cause you will have a lot of it in this game) but if you do buy it and play enough you MIGHT feel that you got enough out of your money's worth. I have about 350-400 hours across multiple accounts and sometimes i don't tho ! But hey, it ain't everybody that has the same standards, just like i love goth girls and you probably love brunettes but that is of no use in this review.

Do as you please padawan.
